Article Title: Blast near BJP booth chief's house in Bengal
Article Text: RANAGHAT: A bomb exploded in front of a BJP booth president's house in Ranaghat in Bengal's Nadia district on Friday night, prompting the saffron party to blame Trinamool workers for the blast.The victim, Kalyan Ghosh , alleged that TMC councillor Joydeep Dutta masterminded the blast. "Three TMC men fled away when people came out hearing the blast," he said.BJP on Saturday lodged a complaint with Election Commission, but TMC denied the charge.BJP supporters mobbed Ranaghat police station, demanding immediate arrest of the culprits.
Article Summary: A bomb exploded in front of a BJP booth president's house in Ranaghat in Bengal's Nadia district on Friday night. The victim, Kalyan Ghosh, alleged that TMC councillor Joydeep Dutta masterminded the blast. TMC denied the charge.

Article Title: After Amethi, 'shehzada' will flee Wayanad too, taunts PM Modi
Article Text: CHHATRAPATI SAMBHAJINAGAR: PM Narendra Modi took a swipe at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi at a campaign rally on Saturday, saying after Amethi, " Congress shehzada " will have to "run away" from Wayanad as well. The PM was in Maharashtra and Karnataka to campaign for BJP and NDA candidates ."Shehzada is facing a difficult situation in Wayanad. Shehzada and his gang are waiting for polling on April 26 to get over so that they can find another safe seat for him.Their own alliance partners are abusing the shehzada in Wayanad. And they are using such abusive language against him, which even I have not used against him," Modi said in Nanded. He addressed two public rallies, one each in Nanded and Parbhani districts of Maharashtra.He mentioned that surveys indicated a favourable voting pattern for NDA in the first phase of Lok Sabha elections held Friday and dismissed INDIA bloc as unable to pose a challenge.Modi highlighted internal conflicts within the opposition alliance, stating that some INDIA bloc politicians are not actively campaigning for their candidates. "There are 25% seats, where the alliance is facing infighting and even talking about putting their partners in prison," he said.In Parbhani, the PM criticised Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance in Maharashtra, accusing Congress and the "fake Shiv Sena" of neglecting sadhus killed in Palghar.During a rally in Chikkaballapura, 60km from Bengaluru, which marked the PM's fourth appearance in Karnataka this election season, Modi said "big and influential" figures, both within India and abroad, have aligned to oust him from office. He expressed his gratitude for the "protective shield" he gets from "Nari Shakti" (women empowerment) and "Maatru Shakti" (motherly power), enabling him to confront and overcome challenges.In an interview with a regional Malayalam television channel, Modi reiterated his plans to intervene in the Karuvannur Cooperative Bank scam, while denying allegations of political use of central agencies. He reaffirmed his commitment to combating corruption through agencies like ED and CBI.He blamed Congress for the water crisis in Marathwada region of Maharashtra and in Karnataka. Referring to the water crisis in parts of Bengaluru, Modi accused Congress govt of turning the tech city into a "tanker city" and allowing the tanker mafia to thrive.(Inputs from Bengaluru, Thiruvananthapuram)
Article Summary: PM Narendra Modi was in Maharashtra and Karnataka to campaign for BJP and NDA candidates. He addressed two public rallies, one each in Nanded and Parbhani districts of Maharashtra. He blamed Congress for the water crisis in Marathwada region of Maharashtra and in Karnataka.

Article Title: 112-year-old will show GenZ why it has no alibi
Article Text: MUMBAI: Kanchanben Nandkishore Badshah is ready to go the extra mile to do her duty. The 112-year-old Breach Candy resident is determined to step out of home on May 20 to cast her vote for Lok Sabha election . This, despite having the ' vote-from-home ' facility that Election Commission has rolled out for the first time for those over 85 and persons with disabilities."...I'd want to go out and vote," Kanchanben smiles, speaking animatedly in Gujarati, her grandson Parind Badshah playing interpreter for TOI."Younger people out there should have no reason not to go vote."Born in 1912, the elderly woman lost her husband early in life, and has outlived her three children. Kanchanben hobbles comfortably around the house using a walker although her hands tremble a bit - something her grandson says could be expected when she'll cast her vote. But, by far, she's independent, he says. She makes her own food and tea occasionally, but insists on churning out her own ghee. "She loves to read the newspapers and has a healthy daily routine...," he says.The polling booth is a couple of lanes away from their home, her grandson says, adding that it's no trouble escorting her there.Polling officers are impressed with the supercentenarian. "She's an example for all of us... to do our constitutional duty," said Nayana Pawar, nodal officer from Malabar Hill constituency (185 ). South Mumbai returning officer Ravi Katakdhond said efforts are being made to reach out to every 85-plus voter. "We've traced most of the voters... Our aim is that they exercise their franchise. We have made all arrangements for them, our officials will visit their homes," he said.Kanchanben, who has lived through both World Wars and the Partition reels out anecdotes in detail. She loves to go for car drives, enjoys sada dosa and ice cream.
Article Summary: Kanchanben Nandkishore Badshah, 112, is determined to cast her vote for Lok Sabha election. Born in 1912, the elderly woman lost her husband early in life, and has outlived her three children. She makes her own food and tea occasionally, but insists on churning out her own ghee.

Article Title: 2 more Punjab Congress ministers join BJP
Article Text: Congress in Punjab suffered yet another setback ahead of Lok Sabha elections in the state with the wife of former MP Santokh Singh Chaudhary , Karmjeet Kaur Chaudhary, joining BJP on Saturday. Santokh passed away during Rahul Gandhi 's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Punjab in 2023. Tajinder Bittu, AICC secretary in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, also joined BJP on Saturday.Bittu was a close aide of Priyanka Gandhi and former chairman of Jalandhar Improvement Trust.BJP, which is contesting the polls in the border state solo, further bolstered its chances with joining of the two leaders.Bittu announced his resignation from Congress hours before joining BJP. He and Karamjit Kaur Chaudhary joined BJP in the presence of Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and its national general secretary Vinod Tawde.
Article Summary: Santokh Singh Chaudhary's wife Karmjeet joins BJP. Tajinder Bittu, AICC secretary in-charge of Himachal Pradesh, also joined BJP. Santokh passed away during Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Punjab in 2023.

Article Title: 'No courage to ...': PM Modi's Rajya Sabha dig at Sonia Gandhi
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday took a subtle dig at former Congress president Sonia Gandhi , suggesting that some leaders have lost the courage to contest elections While addressing a rally at Nanded in Maharashtra, without taking names, the Prime Minister said some INDIA bloc leaders who have been members of the Lok Sabha for several years, have left the Lower House of Parliament and found a seat in the Rajya Sabha as they have no confidence to contest elections."Whatever claims these people make, the truth is that Congress leaders have already accepted defeat even before the announcement of elections. This is the very reason that a few of their leaders, who used to contest and win Lok Sabha seats, have this time entered through the Rajya Sabha route," PM Modi said."For the first time, the family will not vote for a Congress candidate in the constituency where they live as there is no party candidate there," he added.Senior Congress leader Sonia Gandhi was elected unopposed to Rajya Sabha from Rajasthan. This is her first stint in the Upper House after serving 6 terms in Lok Sabha. This is will be the first time that Sonia would not contest in the Lok Sabha election since entering politics nearly two-and-a-half decades ago.Sonia had penned a letter to the voters of Rae Bareli announcing that she will not contest Lok Sabha polls due to health concerns. Sonia has won the Rae Bareli seat five times since 1999. In 2019, Rae Bareli was the only seat won by Congress in Uttar Pradesh.PM Modi also targeted Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, predicting that he will lose the Wayanad seat. "After losing Amethi, the Congress' Sahabzade will lose Wayanad as well. So he will have to look for a safe seat after April 26," he said.The Prime Minister criticized the opposition's INDIA bloc, stating that the alliance lacks a face to project and that people are uncertain about entrusting the country's future to them.He described the alliance as a group of selfish individuals who have united to protect their corrupt practices. PM Modi pointed out that the INDIA bloc partners were fighting each other for 25 per cent of the Lok Sabha seats, questioning their ability to govern effectively after the election."If this is the situation now, what will they do after the election?" PM Modi said.The Prime Minister appealed to voters to come out in large numbers to exercise their voting right in the Lok Sabha elections.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a subtle dig at former Congress president Sonia Gandhi. PM Modi said some INDIA bloc leaders who have been members of the Lok Sabha for several years, have left the Lower House of Parliament and found a seat in the Rajya Sabha.

Article Title: Doordarshan's 'saffron' logo sparks political slugfest
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The visual makeover for Doordarshan 's news channels marked by a change in the colour of its logo from red to orange has sparked a controversy , with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and I&B minister locking horns over what the opposition called an attempt to "saffronise" the national broadcaster.Mamata slammed the move calling it "absolutely unethical, grossly illegal, and speaks loudly of the pro-BJP bias of the national public broadcaster" and demanded Election Commission's intervention.I&B minister Anurag Thakur, however, shrugged off the charge and suggested that Mamata's stand was in keeping with her resistance to "anything saffron ".Prasar Bharti CEO Gaurav Dwivedi also pushed against the charge saying, "No surprises there, your love for 'saffron' is publicly known :) Didi, Bharat Mata ki Jai." He argued that the move was meant for visual enhancement and the colour that has raised hackles is, in fact, orange and not saffron as being alleged.Congress MP and former I&B minister Manish Tewari criticised the switch saying it was a move to assert BJP govt's control over the public broadcaster. "This is an attempt on the part of the govt to saffronise and capture the govt institutions. The said move clearly undermines the neutrality and credibility of India's public broadcaster," he wrote on X.TMC MP Jawahar Sircar, who served as CEO of Prasar Bharati, also criticised the alleged saffronisation of the national broadcaster saying, "As ex-CEO of Prasar Bharati it hurts to see the saffronisation of Doordarshan's logo - just before elections! It will influence voters, by overlaying the colour one religion and Sangh Parivar colour with a 'neutral' Public Broadcaster and a biassed Govt/Regime."Dwivedi, however, argued that the adoption of a vibrant, visually appealing colour was part of the channel's branding and aesthetic upgrade. "The colour is orange, not saffron," he clarified, further explaining, "It's not just the logo that underwent change, the entire visual identity has been revamped. It's regrettable that people are reading more into this than necessary. We've been working on revitalising DD's look and feel for the past six to eight months."Established on Sept 15, 1959, the national broadcaster had its logo designed by Devashish Bhattacharya, a student of the National Institute of Design.Contrary to political speculations, the broadcaster clarified that the colour change is rooted in the logo's history and aesthetic appeal. It pointed out that the original logo, chosen by then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and introduced in 1976 along with theme music composed by Pandit Ravi Shankar and Ustad Ali Ahmed Hussain Khan, featured an orange hue against a green backdrop.The vice-president of Andhra BJP, Vishnu Vardhan Reddy attacked the critics saying, "When #Doordarshan was launched in 1959, it had a saffron logo. Now, as the govt reintroduces the original logo, liberals and #Congress are outraging over it. It's blatantly obvious they harbour hate against 'Bhagwa' and Hindus."
Article Summary: Mamata Banerjee and I&B minister Anurag Thakur lock horns over colour of Doordarshan's logo. Opposition calls it an attempt to "saffronise" the national broadcaster. Prasar Bharti CEO Gaurav Dwivedi says the colour is orange and not saffron.

Article Title: INDIA alliance tries to convince TMC for joint manifesto
Article Text:
TMC objects to caste census in manifesto

NEW DELHI: Trinamool Congress has thrown a spanner in the works of the INDIA alliance plan to release a joint manifesto for the opposition bloc to convey a sense of purpose and unity going forward in the Lok Sabha elections .Well-placed sources said efforts are on to bring TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee around by impressing upon her the urgency to put out a minimal consensus document laying out the promises of the opposition to the voters as her opposition is proving to be the main stumbling block to its release.Sources said TMC has objected to the inclusion of “caste census” in the joint document, which is in line with its earlier red flag to the flagship policy measure on social justice. However, TMC had in the past come around when the INDIA grouping in one of its meetings succeeded in putting “caste census” in its agenda document, and then also repeated it in the public rallies.For the TMC to again raise an objection to the promise that if voted to power, the opposition will hold a nationwide headcount to determine the population of OBCs as well as other communities, appears to have raised doubts in key opposition quarters behind the intention of the Bengal outfit. Sources said the TMC appears more keen to stall the joint document, and is only using “caste census” as a pretext. Meanwhile, Mamata again on Saturday accused Congress and CPM for being hand in glove with BJP in West Bengal, and said “I had coined the name INDIA, but INDIA doesn’t exist in Bengal, it exists outside the state”.Sources said there is no point in releasing a document without “caste census” because it is a key plank of the Congress manifesto, and there is an unanimity on it in the coalition barring the TMC. Else, the option is to unveil the manifesto without the TMC’s support.The joint document is also likely to have a few key flagship promises made by Congress in its manifesto, on which there is practically an agreement with other constituents of the India bloc .
Article Summary: Trinamool Congress has thrown a spanner in the works of the INDIA alliance plan to release a joint manifesto for the opposition bloc. TMC has objected to the inclusion of “caste census’ in the joint document, which is in line with its earlier red flag to social justice.

Article Title: 'Paida toh bahut kar diye …': Nitish Kumar takes a swipe at Lalu Yadav over 'too many children'; Tejashwi responds
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar on Saturday targeted Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadav for allegedly promoting his family members in politics.Furthermore, Nitish held the RJD leader responsible for the poor infrastructure and law and order situation in Bihar during his tenure as chief minister. He accused Yadav of involving his sons, daughters, and other family members in politics, while neglecting the development of the state.Kumar claimed that during Lalu's rule, people faced difficulties due to the lack of proper roads and education facilities."Now they have involved their sons, daughters, and everyone. They keep saying something or other everywhere. They forget the old things, hence, I want to tell everyone that no work used to get done. People could not get out, there were no roads or education," Nitish said.Meanwhile, Tejashwi Yadav, the son of Lalu Prasad, reacted to the comments made by Nitish Kumar, stating that personal remarks will not benefit the citizens of Bihar."He can say anything to us. Whatever he says is like a blessing for me. But the thing is, will such personal remarks benefit the people of Bihar... In elections, issues should be discussed. Who is writing such speeches for him? He should speak on education, employment and stopping migration," Tejashwi said while speaking to reporters.Two of Lalu Prasad's daughters, Misa Bharti and Rohini Acharya, are currently contesting the parliamentary elections from Pataliputra and Saran Lok Sabha seats, respectively.Additionally, Yadav's younger son, Tejashwi Yadav, served as the deputy chief minister in the previous Nitish-led government, while his older son, Tej Pratap Yadav, held the environment portfolio.Janata Dal (United), led by Nitish Kumar, is participating in the Lok Sabha elections as part of the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) after Nitish left the opposition INDIA bloc and rejoined the NDA.
Article Summary: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar targeted Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadav. He accused Yadav of involving his sons, daughters, and other family members in politics, while neglecting the development of the state.

Article Title: Lok Sabha polls: FIR lodged against DK Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and Karnataka BJP chief B Y Vijayendra
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Election Commission of Karnataka announced on Saturday that First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered against prominent Karnataka politicians, including deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and state BJP chief B Y Vijayendra, for various alleged violations related to the ongoing Lok Sabha elections.According to posts on social media platform X by the chief electoral officer of Karnataka, FIRs have been lodged against these politicians.According to the EC , Shivakumar allegedly violated the MCC while addressing apartment owners in RR Nagara in the run-up to the Lok Sabha elections. The FIR has filed under Section 171 (B)(C)(E)(F) of IPC for "bribery and undue influence" at elections.HD Kumaraswamy, on the other hand, has been accused of making false statements in connection with the elections.B Y Vijayendra, the state BJP chief, has been charged with posting derogatory content against the Congress from the official X handle of the Karnataka BJP.The polling in Karnataka for the 28 seats to the 18th Lok Sabha will be held on April 26 and May 7 in the second and third phases respectively.The counting of votes will take place on June 4.
Article Summary: First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered against prominent Karnataka politicians. They include deputy chief minister D K Shivakumar, JD(S) chief H D Kumaraswamy, and state BJP chief B Y Vijayendra. According to posts on social media platform X, FIRs have been lodged against these politicians.

Article Title: Wayanad Congress secretary slams Rahul Gandhi, joins BJP
Article Text: Wayanad district Congress committee general secretary on Saturday quit the party to join BJP as he reasoned that the grand old party had lost relevance in national politics and Rahul Gandhi didn't tour his Lok Sabha constituency in the last 5 years.P M Sudhakaran , who had been a loyal Congressman for four decades, said only BJP can provide a consistent and welfare-oriented governance in the country.He added that he joined BJP without any conditions after meeting with BJP state chief and Wayanad candidate K Surendran.
Article Summary: P M Sudhakaran had been a loyal Congressman for four decades. He said only BJP can provide a consistent and welfare-oriented governance in the country. He joined BJP without any conditions after meeting with BJP state chief and Wayanad candidate K Surendran.

Article Title: Congress-SP wiped out in UP in first phase of Lok Sabha polls: Amit Shah
Article Text: AGRA/JAIPUR/KOTA/BHILWARA: Union home minister Amit Shah claimed at a large election rally in support of BJP's Mathura candidate Hema Malini in Vrindavan on Saturday that "Congress and SP" had been "wiped out in the first phase" in Uttar Pradesh."In 2017, two princes had come together... They have come together in 2024 as well, (but) BJP will win maximum seats in the state," Shah said in reference to Congress's Rahul Gandhi and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav.In Kota, Rajasthan, Shah said if people had voted for Congress in 2019, Kota would have become a bastion for Popular Front of India (PFI), an oblique reference to the banned outfit's foundation day rally in 2022. Alleging that Congress will lift the ban on PFI if it is elected to office, Shah asked, "Ban on PFI should continue or not?"The question was answered with a resounding "Yes". Kota goes to polls in the second phase on April 26."Your vote for BJP should be for decisive actions such as the scrapping of Article 370, ending terrorism, fighting Naxalism, and building the Ram temple in Ayodhya. This is why we have to vote for Modi," he said.Shah referred to Congress as "Sardar of Falsehood" and accused it of misleading the country by stating that BJP is seeking 400 seats to scrap reservation. "You gave us majority in 2014 and 2019, we didn't use it to scrap reservation but to scrap Article 370, build the Ram temple, and bring CAA to grant citizenship to persecuted Hindus, Sikhs, and Buddhists," he said.In Vrindavan, Shah accused Congress and SP of involvement in scams and corruption worth Rs 12 lakh crore and contrasted their alleged malfeasance with PM Narendra Modi 's "unblemished" record. Mathura also goes to polls in the second phase on April 26.Shah also took potshots at Rahul Gandhi for his allegedly frequent trips to Thailand, a point he had raised at a public rally in Pali on Friday as well. Extending his jab to include AICC general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Shah suggested that the Gandhis couldn't bear the heat of Indian summers and opted for vacations abroad, most recently to Thailand. "On the one hand, we have a leadership that goes to Thailand, while on the other hand PM Modi has worked hard for past 23 years without a break," Shah said.He warned Congress of serious repercussions if the party plans to alter the reservation system. "Rahul Baba, don't spread lies, and listen to me with an open ear. If the Congress party wants to scrap reservation, as long as a BJP worker is alive, they would never allow reservation to SC/ST, OBC to be scrapped, and it is Modi's guarantee', Shah said.
Article Summary: Union home minister Amit Shah claimed at a large election rally in support of BJP's Mathura candidate Hema Malini in Vrindavan on Saturday that "Congress and SP" had been "wiped out in the first phase" in Uttar Pradesh. Shah also took potshots at Rahul Gandhi for his allegedly frequent trips to Thailand.

Article Title: Lok Sabha election turnout dips in Madhya Pradesh, a first in 2 decades
Article Text: The 2024 Lok Sabha election has begun with a puzzle - voting percentage has dropped for the first time in a LS poll in Madhya Pradesh in two decades, but neither BJP nor Congress seem worried.The nearly 8% plunge in MP polling is far steeper than the national average drop this time.Over past 20 years, Congress has had a stable 35% vote share in parliamentary elections while BJP has 55%.There are 7% fence-sitters who may go either way. Going by the turnout , either BJP has failed to achieve the 370-plus target or Congress's 35% vote share has been encroached upon.State BJP media cell chief Ashish Agarwal said, "BJP's vote share is continuously growing in MP. The drop in turnout is because Congress' voters did not come out."PCC chief spokesman Abbas Hafeez countered, "Congress sees this drop positively. It shows that the wave is now going against BJP."But former CEC OP Rawat feels weather was a factor: " Heat makes it difficult for voters to step out."
Article Summary: The nearly 8% plunge in MP polling is far steeper than the national average drop this time. Over past 20 years, Congress has had a stable 35% vote share in parliamentary elections while BJP has 55%. There are 7% fence-sitters who may go either way.

Article Title: Red zone Gadchiroli may break polling record, cross 72%
Article Text: GADCHIROLI : Poll percentage in Gadchiroli-Chimur Lok Sabha constituency may surpass the record 72% of 2019, show trends and feedback on voters’ turnout this time. Even in 2014, the constituency had reported 70% polling.The final voter turnout is yet to be declared as polling parties are still returning from some highly sensitive pockets of Gadchiroli, Aheri and Armori, especially the ones adjoining People’s Liberation Guerilla Army, a Maoist base in Abujmarh.Like in 2014 and 2019, the constituency has already topped the state with 70.38% polling (as on Friday) due to high voter turnout in its four assembly segments — Brahmapuri (75.10 %), Chimur (74.41%), Amgaon (69.24%) and Aheri (66.83%).Collector Sanjay Daine said voters turned up to exercise their franchise despite reports of heat wave. “Adequate medical arrangements were in place at far off places to tackle any emergency.”SP Neelotpal said EVMs are safely being shifted to the strongroom. “There are no delays but polling parties and EVMs are being shifted with due precaution. We have deployed maximum helicopters this year but certain distances have to be covered on foot under high risk,” said Neelotpal. Deputy district officer Vivek Ghodke said lives were saved from heat wave due to early and focused responses.
Article Summary: Poll percentage in Gadchiroli-Chimur Lok Sabha constituency may surpass the record 72% of 2019. The final voter turnout is yet to be declared as polling parties are still returning from some highly sensitive pockets. Even in 2014, the constituency had reported 70% polling.

Article Title: Avoid contact with lawyers: Madras high court to subordinate judges
Article Text: CHENNAI: Maintain a degree of aloofness, and avoid personal contact with individual lawyers and closed-chamber meetings with advocates practicing in the same court. These are among Madras high court 's latest set of advisories to subordinate judicial officers in Tamil Nadu, urging them to maintain professional decorum and uphold the integrity of the judiciary.An official circular issued on April 18 by HC's registrar-general states: "Judicial officers of the district judiciary shall avoid mobile contacts and closed chamber meetings with practicing advocates, unless it is necessary to have such chamber meetings and mobile contact with the Bar association office bearers relating to common issues and the smooth functioning of the court."Every judicial officer must at all times be conscious that they are under the public gaze, and there should be no act or omission by them that is unbecoming of the high office they occupy and the public esteem in which that office is held, the circular says. It also calls upon subordinate judicial officers to adhere strictly to judicial ethics, with a focus on behaviour and conduct that reaffirms public trust in the impartiality of the judiciary.
Article Summary: Madras high court's latest set of advisories to subordinate judicial officers in Tamil Nadu. Circular urges them to maintain professional decorum and uphold integrity of the judiciary. Every judicial officer must at all times be conscious that they are under the public gaze, circular says.

Article Title: BJP candidate from Moradabad seat Kunwar Sarvesh Kumar dies
Article Text: NEW DELHI: BJP candidate from Moradabad Lok Sabha seat Kunwar Sarvesh Kumar 72, who was unwell for some time, died at Delhi's Aiims on Saturday, a senior party leader said."Kunwar Sarvesh Kumar has passed away. He had some problem in his throat and had an operation. Yesterday, he had gone to Aiims for a check-up," said UP BJP chief Bhupendra Chaudhary.He served as the member of Parliament for Moradabad from 2014 to 2019.However, he lost the 2019 elections to ST Hasan of the SP (supported by BSP, SP, and RLD).Kumar was also a five-time MLA for the BJP, representing the Thakurdwara assembly constituency in Moradabad from 1991 to 2007 and again from 2012 to 2014. He is survived by his wife Sadna Singh, a son, and a daughter.Condoling his death, UP Chief Minister in a post on X in Hindi said, "I am shocked by the demise of BJP candidate from Moradabad Lok Sabha constituency and former MP Kunwar Sarvesh Singh ji. This is an irreparable loss for the BJP family. My condolences are with the bereaved family. I pray to Lord Shri Ram to give a place to the departed soul in his feet and provide strength to the bereaved family and their supporters to bear this loss. Om Shaanti."Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid his respect to Kumar calling it 'untimely demise' he tweeted, "I am deeply saddened by the untimely demise of BJP candidate from Moradabad Lok Sabha seat and former MP Kunwar Sarvesh Singh ji. He remained dedicated to public service and social service till his last breath. His demise is an irreparable loss for the party. I pray to God to give strength to his family to bear this deep grief. Om Shanti!"
Article Summary: Kunwar Sarvesh Kumar had some problem in his throat and had an operation. He served as the member of Parliament for Moradabad from 2014 to 2019. He lost the 2019 elections to ST Hasan of the SP (supported by BSP, SP, and RLD).

Article Title: Making a debut with development agenda
Article Text: Poomkavu, a nondescript village intersection on Konni-Chandanappally road, wore a deserted look at 4pm as sweltering heat gripped the whole atmosphere. A flurry of activities started picking up at a corner as four men past their 60s began putting up posters. A few more joined them and the first announcement vehicle seeking votes for NDA candidate Anil Antony for the development of Pathanamthitta constituency reached the spot in another 30 minutes.In the meantime, the pilot speaker was heard claiming that days are not far when the value of Indian rupee overtakes US dollars, under the next Modi govt .As the candidate's vehicle pulled in, the atmosphere was already charged up. "Thank you all. The purpose of the upcoming election is not just to choose an MP. It's an opportunity to stand with honourable Prime Minister Narendra Modi's efforts to make India a developed country. When NDA wins more than 400 seats this time, one of those seats should be Pathanamthitta," said Anil Antony in his brief speech. Party workers took him to the autorickshaw stand nearby where he greeted them and took selfies with a few, a practice which marked such receptions throughout his campaign.Above the din of the escorting publicity vehicle, Anil said he joined BJP without any demand and his candidacy in Pathanamthitta was solely the decision of central leaders. "Congress has degenerated into a party that works for one family. They don't have a vision and are totally obsolete," he said, adding that it was Modi's vision for the country that attracted him to BJP.The people, terrain and the socio-cultural and religious mix of Pathanamthitta were unique and people were desperately looking for a change, he said, as he continued waving hands at people who came out of their homes to greet the candidate. "I'm going to win. No doubt about it," he said, as he brushed aside allegations against him as just political conspiracies.But how does the son of former Kerala chief minister A K Antony feel when his own father openly expressed his wish that Anil Antony should not win? "I respect my father. But we don't talk politics," he quipped, without concealing his irritation over more inquisitive questions about the father-son relationship.The bachelor son of AK Antony repeated the PM's vision - 400-plus seats and development - at every reception and finally at the roadshow in Konni town.According to Anil, who promises to bring unprecedented developments in Pathanamthitta, his 'dog barking at moon' jibe was not aimed at his father. "It's a common aphorism in Malayalam and it applies to all Congressmen harping on an obsolete ideology," he said.
Article Summary: Anil Antony is the NDA candidate for the development of Pathanamthitta constituency. The bachelor son of AK Antony repeated the PM's vision - 400-plus seats and development - at every reception and finally at the roadshow in Konni town.

Article Title: Pakistan imposes Section 144 in Punjab ahead of by-elections
Article Text: ISLAMABAD: Ahead of the by-elections in different districts of Pakistan's Punjab , the provincial government has imposed Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC), Pakistan-based ARY News reported.According to details, Section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in districts where by-elections are being held, including Lahore, Kasur and Chakwal. Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Bhakkar, Rahim Yar Khan, Wazirabad, Narowal, Sheikhupura, and Dera Ghazi Khan.In this regard, a notification has been issued which mentions that Section 144 will remain enforced from April 18 to 22, according to ARY News report. No one will be permitted to carry or display weapons and action will be taken against those who violate the rule. Notably, the by-elections is due to take place on April 21.Earlier on Wednesday, the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) handed over 6.23 million ballot papers to concerned returning officers (ROs) for by-elections in 21 constituencies, ARY News reported, citing sources. As per the details, approximately 2.55 million people in Pakistan will vote for the five National Assembly constituencies.Furthermore, around 3.61 million people will exercise their right to vote for 16 provincial assemblies seats in Pakistan. Over 6.23 million ballot papers have been printed, with green-coloured papers for the National Assembly and white-coloured papers for the provincial assemblies, ARY News reported, citing sources.The ballot papers were given to the ROs of the respective constituencies to ensure a smooth voting process. As many as 47 candidates will contest for five National Assembly seats. Moreover, 16 provincial assembly constituencies are up for grabs.The by-elections encompass five National Assembly seats, 12 Punjab Assembly seats, two seats in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly, and two seats in the Balochistan Assembly. Notably, Aseefa Bhutto Zardari has been elected unopposed for NA 207.A total of 237 candidates were vying for 21 vacant seats in national and provincial assemblies during the by-elections scheduled to take place on April 21, according to ARY News report.As many as 23 candidates are in the running for the vacant seats in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly, while 154 candidates were up for grabs in Punjab. Zubair Ahmed Junejo secured his seat unopposed on PS-80 in Sindh. A total of 12 candidates are vying for the empty seats in the Balochistan Assembly.
Article Summary: Section 144 of the Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) has been imposed in Lahore, Kasur and Chakwal. No one will be permitted to carry or display weapons and action will be taken against those who violate the rule. The by-elections is due to take place on April 21.

Article Title: 2 Indian students found dead at Scottish sightseeing spot
Article Text: LONDON: Two Indian students were Wednesday found dead in the water at a popular sightseeing spot in Scotland . The bodies of the two men were recovered on Wednesday night by emergency services from the water at the Linn of Tummel , picturesque roaring waterfalls surrounded by rocks situated northwest of Pitlochry in Perthshire, where the rivers Garry and Tummel meet.TOI understands four friends, all students at Dundee University , were trekking when two of the men fell into the water and drowned. The deceased were aged 22 and 27. The two other students called emergency services. Police, fire and ambulance services rushed to the scene.A spokesperson for the Indian high commission in London said: "Two India students hailing from Andhra Pradesh drowned in an unfortunate incident Wednesday evening and their bodies were found a little downstream. Consulate general of India has been in touch with families of the students and a consular official has met the relative of one the students who lives in the UK. University of Dundee has assured of all help. The post-mortem is expected to take place on 19 April and thereafter procedures for repatriating bodies to India will be done."A Police Scotland spokesperson said: "Around 7pm on Wednesday, we received a report of two men in the water at the Linn of Tummel waterfall near Blair Atholl. Emergency services attended and following searches in the area, the bodies of two men were recovered from the water. Enquiries are ongoing to establish the full circumstances. However, there would not appear to be any suspicious circumstances surrounding these deaths. A report will be submitted to the procurator fiscal (public prosecutor with the powers to impose fines, in Scotland)."
Article Summary: Two Indian students were Wednesday found dead in the water at a popular sightseeing spot in Scotland. The bodies of the two men were recovered on Wednesday night by emergency services. Four friends, all students at Dundee University were trekking when two of the men fell into the water and drowned.

Article Title: Lok Sabha elections: Strong turnout in Arunachal Pradesh despite rain; CM Conrad K Sangma among first to vote in Meghalaya
Article Text: GUWAHATI: Despite light rains in Arunachal Pradesh , voters were seen standing in queue even before polling began. Meanwhile, Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma reached the polling booth in Tura at 6.20am and cast his vote after standing in queue for more than 30 minutes.Arunachal Pradesh and Meghalaya have two parliamentary seats each.Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said, "I had come very early in the morning hoping to be one of the medal winners and first five to vote.I reached the polling station at 6.20am and was surprised to see that the polling station was packed with a long queue. I have not seen this kind of queue earlier. More participation of voters is good for democracy."On the other hand, polling in Assam is also going on in a peaceful manner with early participation of candidates from different political parties.BJP candidate from Sonitpur constituency, Ranjit Dutta, cast his vote early in the morning in his home constituency, while Congress candidate from Jorhat, Gaurav Gogoi, who reached the polling booth, appealed to the people of his constituency to exercise their democratic right.On the other hand, National Democratic Progressive Party (NDPP) candidate Chumben Murry, a doctor turned politician, after casting his vote said, "There is a lot of positive vibes in the air in Nagaland this year. People should come in large numbers and participate in the electoral process."He is contesting against Congress contender Supongmeren Jamir.He had earlier dismissed the Eastern Nagaland People's Organisation's decision to boycott the elections due to the government's alleged failure to meet their demands, emphasizing that the NDA administration, not the Congress, holds the key to addressing their grievances.Meanwhile, Union minister and former Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal has gone out to visit polling booths in his constituency, Dibrugarh, after casting his vote and exuded confidence for a better result.Sarbananda Sonowal said, "I call on all eligible voters, especially the youth and first-time voters, to come out and cast your vote. This is your moment to Arise, Awake, & Strengthen the journey of Viksit Bharat."
Article Summary: Voters were seen standing in queue even before polling began in Arunachal Pradesh. Meghalaya CM Conrad K Sangma reached the polling booth in Tura at 6.20am and cast his vote. On the other hand, polling in Assam is also going on in a peaceful manner.

Article Title: Govt fixes wheat procurement target at 34.15 million tones for 2023-24
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The government has fixed a wheat procurement target of 34.15 million tonnes for the 2023-24 marketing year starting April, higher than 18.79 million tonnes purchased in the previous year.The target was fixed in the meeting of state food secretaries held alongside state food ministers' conference here to discuss procurement arrangements. The meeting was chaired by Food Secretary Sanjeev Chopra.Out of the total wheat procurement target for the 2022-23 marketing year (April-March), Punjab will aim to procure 2.5 million tonnes wheat, Haryana 1.5 million tonnes and Madhya Pradrsh 2 million tonnes, the food ministry said in a statement.Wheat procurement had declined last year due to a fall in domestic production and higher exports.However, the government has projected a record wheat production at 112.18 million tonnes in the 2023-24 crop year (July-June) as per the second estimate of the agriculture ministry.Besides wheat, the government has also fixed rabi (winter) rice procurement target at 10.6 million tonnes in the 2022-23 marketing year.States have been advised to enhance rice milling capacity so that milling of one season gets completed before the commencement of next season and recycling of rice may be avoided.Whereas procurement of millets and coarse grains is estimated to be 7,50,000 tonnes this year, higher than 6,30,000 tonnes in 2021-22. Karnataka will procure 6,00,000 tonnes of millets this year, the statement added.Separately addressing the conference, food minister Piyush Goyal urged all state governments to implement smart-PDS at the earliest.He lauded Andhra Pradesh government's Command Control and stated that the central government will work together for implementing it in other states also.On the storage front, the Union minister said FCI is upgrading godowns into five-star rated ones and state governments can also upgrade their godowns.In the conference, all the state governments were told to learn from the best practice of using millets in schemes like mid-day meal and PDS in Karnataka, which is helpful in adding nutrition and promoting healthy diet.States were encouraged to procure more millets and coarse grains. All the state governments were asked to open procurement centres for coarse grains in producing districts, especially, in tribal areas. State governments were asked to encourage consumption of coarse grains as well.The conference also deliberated on fighting anaemia and nutritional deficiencies in various parts of the country by suitably creating awareness on benefits of fortified rice.The issues related to smart Public Distribution System (PDS) and One Nation One Ration Card scheme for seamless delivery of foodgrains to migrant beneficiaries were also discussed.FCI (Food Corporation of India) is the government's nodal agency that undertakes procurement and distribution of foodgrains for the PDS and welfare schemes.The best practice of command control centre by Andhra Pradesh for real time data on procurement, storage, quality and distribution of foodgrains was also discussed, for which all states have been urged to learn and adopt the methods to make their systems effective and efficient.Further, implementation of additional minimum threshold parameters for online procurement operations, i.e. integration of power validation of milled rice quantity with electricity consumption and tracking of vehicles used for transporting food grains were also deliberated upon for improving efficiency and transparency in procurement operations.During the discussion, it emerged that sufficient jute bags are available as per requirement of ensuing season. Issues related to finalisation of audited accounts, food subsidy claims and rationalisation of food subsidy was also deliberated upon.State governments have also been asked to submit their pending bills to FCI so that those can be settled in March 2023.
Article Summary: The government has fixed a wheat procurement target of 34.15 million tonnes for the 2023-24 marketing year starting April. The target was fixed in the meeting of state food secretaries held alongside state food ministers' conference here to discuss procurement arrangements.Wheat procurement had declined last year due to a fall in domestic production and higher exports.

Article Title: Jio: Reliance Jio launches 5G services in 50 more cities; total number hits 184
Article Text: MUMBAI: Reliance Jio on Tuesday announced the largest launch of its True 5G services across 50 cities in the country. With this, Jio users across 184 cities are now enjoying the fifth-generation mobile services.According to the company's statement, these 50 cities are in states including Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu.Jio users in these cities will be invited to the Jio Welcome Offer to experience unlimited data at up to 1 Gbps speeds at no additional cost, starting on Tuesday, the statement said.Jio spokesperson said, "We are thrilled to launch Jio True 5G services in 50 additional cities across 17 states and Union Territories, taking the total count to 184 cities. This is by far one of the largest rollouts of 5G services, not just in India, but anywhere in the world.""We have stepped up the speed and intensity of True 5G roll-out across the nation because we want every Jio user to enjoy the transformational benefits of Jio True 5G technology in the new year 2023. The entire nation will be able to enjoy and benefit from Jio True 5G services by December 2023," the spokesperson said.The cities of Chittoor, Kadapa, Narasaraopet, Ongole, Rajamahendravaram, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram in Andhra Pradesh; Nagaon in Assam; Bilaspur, Korba and Rajnandgaon in Chhattisgarh; Panaji in Goa; Ambala, Bahadurgarh, Hisar, Karnal, Panipat, Rohtak, Sirsa and Sonipat in Haryana, have access to Jio 5G services now, according to the statement. It also added that Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij inaugurated Jio True 5G in Haryana circle on Tuesday.Jio 5G services are now also live in Dhanbad in Jharkhand; Bagalkote, Chikkamagaluru, Hassan, Mandya and Tumakuru in Karnataka; Alappuzha in Kerala; Kolhapur, Nanded-Waghala, Sangli in Maharashtra; Balasore, Baripada, Bhadrak, Jharsuguda, Puri and Sambalpur in Odisha, the statement said.The cities in Puducherry; Amritsar, Bikaner, Kota in Rajasthan; Dharmapuri, Erode and Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu; Nalgonda in Telangana, and Jhansi, Aligarh, Moradabad, Saharanpur in Uttar Pradesh, and Asansol and Durgapur in West Bengal now have access to Jio 5G services. According to the statement, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla will inaugurate Jio True 5G in Kota.The spokesperson also said, "We are grateful to the State Governments of Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal for their continuous support in our quest to digitise every region."
Article Summary: With this, Jio users across 184 cities are now enjoying the fifth-generation mobile services. These 50 cities are in states including Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Haryana, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Odisha, Puducherry, Punjab, Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu.

Article Title: D Raja, EP lash out against Rahul Gandhi
Article Text: KOZHIKODE: CPI national general secretary D Raja lashed out against UDF candidate in Wayanad Rahul Gandhi while campaigning for LDF candidate Annie Raja on Saturday. Raja told a news conference in Wayand that Rahul's comments against chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan were immature.He said that Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge should advise Rahul and K C Venugopal to stop making such immature comments.Raja said Rahul asked why ED was not arresting Vijayan. "Raising such a question is condemnable. Protests happened across India against the arrest of Delhi CM Arvind Kerjriwal and Jharkhand CM Hemant Soran. Rahul is raising this question in such a situation. Rahul has no clarity on what to say where," Raja said.Meanwhile, LDF convener E P Jayarajan said Rahul is asking why Modi and ED are not arresting Vijayan. First, Rahul should answer as to why he is not being arrested in the National Herald scam, he said. He added that Congress has created a situation where IUML flag cannot be taken out now.
Article Summary: CPI national general secretary D Raja lashed out against UDF candidate in Wayanad Rahul Gandhi while campaigning for LDF candidate Annie Raja. Raja said Rahul's comments against chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan were immature. He said that Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge should advise Rahul and K C Venugopal to stop making such immature comments.

Article Title: If needed, Rahul should contest from north: IUML
Article Text: KANNUR: IUML national general secretary P K Kunhalikutty on Saturday said UDF candidate in Wayanad Rahul Gandhi should contest from an additional seat in north India if it would help INDIA bloc to win more seats."BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi are facing the fear of losing the LS election . Reactions of Modi in a recent interview clearly indicated that fear.Modi claimed that Rahul will find another seat in north India after the second phase of general election. Why can't he contest from one more seat? We support it," Kunhalikutty told a news conference."For the people of Kerala, it is not imperative that Rahul should be here. The people mainly want a secular govt at the Centre under the leadership of Congress party . If Rahul's fight from a north Indian seat helps the party secure more seats, it will definitely be good. However, a final call should be taken by Congress," he added.On the green flag controversy, he said LDF has no moral right to criticise UDF for not allowing green flag as they had forcefully changed flag and symbol of one of their allies.
Article Summary: UDF candidate in Wayanad Rahul Gandhi should contest from an additional seat in north India if it would help INDIA bloc to win more seats. IUML national general secretary P K Kunhalikutty said LDF has no moral right to criticise UDF for not allowing green flag.

Article Title: What is Blue Whale Challenge, the online game linked to Indian student’s death in the US
Article Text:
What is ‘Blue Whale Challenge’

Cases in India: First Blue Whale Challenge victim in 2017

A first-year Indian student in the US was found dead last month. It is reported that he took his own life last month while purportedly playing a game of dares called the “Blue Whale Challenge”, which became a social media phenomena a few years ago. This death, which has been widely reported as a murder, is now being investigated as “apparent suicide”.Often called the “suicide game”, the “Blue Whale Challenge” was created by Philipp Budeikin , a former convict in Russia, in 2013.It has reportedly claimed the lives of over 130 boys and girls in India, the US, China and other countries.This online challenge pressures players into self-harm and suicide over 50 days. Each day involves a “dare” which has to be filmed and shared as “proof.” These dares start easy (horror movies) but escalate to self-mutilation.The cases reported have seen young victims, who are given easy tasks initially, fostering addiction. Later, psychological manipulation keeps them engaged as dares become increasingly dangerous over 50 days.The game works by selecting vulnerable “players" from social media by “the curator”. Blackmail and cyberbullying prevented the players’ escape.Budeikin was arrested with charges of inciting at least 16 teenagers to kill themselves. He pleaded guilty and was also sentenced to three years in prison.In India, the first victim of the deadly challenge was reported dead in July 2017, when 14-year-old Mumbai schoolboy Manpreet Singh Sahani, jumped to death from the seventh floor of a building.A Class X student in West Bengal committed suicide and his body was found in the bathroom with face covered in a plastic bag and with a cord. Another boy, son of a former minister, jumped to death in Delhi. A teenager in Kerala hanged himself to death allegedly while completing a Blue Whale challenge.The Ministry of Electronics and IT in an advisory shared in 2017 called the Blue whale game “an abetment to suicide".
Article Summary: A first-year Indian student in the US was found dead last month. It is reported that he took his own life last month while purportedly playing a game of dares called the ‘Blue Whale Challenge’ It has reportedly claimed the lives of over 130 boys and girls in India, the US, China and other countries.

Article Title: Deepfake video of Ranveer Singh criticising government goes viral: Watch the original clip
Article Text:
Aamir Khan files FIR against fake video

Deepfakes, or digitally altered video and photos, have started to crop up online as India prepares to vote in the Lok Sabha elections 2024 from April 19. Following a fake video of Bollywood actor Aamir Khan endorsing a political party made rounds on the internet, a digitally manipulated clip of actor Ranveer Singh is being shared online.In the video, the actor is shown criticising Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP government at the centre, at the same time seeking votes for Congress.The video ends with Singh urging voters to vote for “nyaay” and the tagline 'Vote For Congress ' is seen flashing on the screen.It doesn’t take a second look to identify that the video is doctored. The lip movements of the actor in the video clearly doesn't match the audio. Notably, it is an old video shot when the actor visited Kashi, and in fact praised PM Modi for changing the face of the 'City of Ghats'.In the original video, Singh says, “I cannot express in words the experience that I have had today. I have been a devotee of lord Shiva and I have come here for the first time…” Here’s the original video:Recently, Aamir Khan filed an FIR against a deepfake video that showed him endorsing a specific political party. The actor’s office strongly denied any connection to politics or affiliation with any political party and issued a statement.“We want to clarify [that] Aamir Khan has never endorsed any political party in his 35-year career. He has dedicated his efforts to raising public awareness through campaigns for the Election Commission for many past elections,” the actor’s office said in the statement, as per news agency ANI.“We are alarmed now to see a recent viral video alleging Mr Khan is promoting a particular party. He would like to clarify [that] this is a fake and totally untrue video. He has reported the matter to various authorities, including filing an FIR with the Cyber Crime Cell of Mumbai Police,” the statement added.A video appears to be from his TV show “Satyamev Jayate,” that aired almost a decade ago.
Article Summary: Deepfakes, or digitally altered video and photos, have started to crop up online as India prepares to vote in the Lok Sabha elections 2024 from April 19. Aamir Khan filed an FIR against a deepfake video that showed him endorsing a specific political party.

Article Title: Need information on Lok Sabha elections 2024: Election Commission has this important 'voting alert' for you
Article Text:
Dear Voters,

With nearly 97 crore voters, 10.5 lakh polling stations and 1.5 crore election officials,

Indian General Elections

2024 is the world’s largest election mobilisation exercise of man and material.

We urge you to join us in this festival of collective expression and empowerment by exercising your invaluable right to vote.

- 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗹𝗲: Voting will be held in seven phases across 543

Parliamentary Constituencies

. Voters can check their poll date and

polling station details

on https://electoralsearch.eci.gov.in/

- 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴: The results will be announced on June 4, 2024.

- 𝗘𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗩𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴: Special arrangements and facilities like water, shed, toilets, ramps, volunteers, wheelchairs, and electricity have been made to ensure that every voter, including elderly and persons with disabilities, can cast their vote with ease.

For your convenience, all essential information related to elections, from registration to polling station to poll dates, and all ECI Apps can be found on the

ECI official platform

https://elections24.eci.gov.in/

Watch this video and join us in celebrating “Chunav ka Parv” where every vote counts!!

You can watch the video here:

The Lok Sabha Elections 2024 are set to take place in seven phases, starting on April 19, for the 543 Lok Sabha seats. Nearly 97 crore voters will be able to cast their votes at about 10.5 lakh polling stations. Ahead of the “world’s largest election mobilisation exercise of man and material”, the Election Commission of India has an important ‘voting alert’ for Indians.In an alert on Facebook, the EC has shared a video and a message, urging all eligible voters to exercise their right to vote. It has also provided links to websites that will offer help on essential information, including how voters can check the schedule of voting, polling stations’ locations and others.
Article Summary: The Lok Sabha Elections 2024 are set to take place in seven phases, starting on April 19, for the 543 Lok Sabha seats. Nearly 97 crore voters will be able to cast their votes at about 10.5 lakh polling stations. The results will be announced on June 4, 2024.

Article Title: Caught providing illegal assistance to Suryakumar Yadav, Mumbai Indians' Kieron Pollard and Tim David fined
Article Text: Mumbai Indians' batsman Tim David and batting coach Kieron Pollard have been fined 20% of respective match fees for breaching IPL's Code of Conduct during Mumbai Indians vs Punjab Kings match. Both admitted to the offence and accepted the match referee's sanction. The controversy revolved around taking DRS for a wide delivery.
Article Summary: Mumbai Indians' batsman Tim David and batting coach Kieron Pollard have been fined 20% of respective match fees for breaching IPL's Code of Conduct. Both admitted to the offence and accepted the match referee's sanction. The controversy revolved around taking DRS for a wide delivery.
